intro: Galium stojanovii subsp. pedunculatum, commonly known as the slender bedstraw, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Western Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its prostrate or ascending growth habit. The plant features small, white or pale pink flowers arranged in clusters, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are opposite, oval-shaped, and often covered with fine hairs. Galium stojanovii subsp. pedunculatum is often found in moist, open habitats such as meadows and stream banks.
